title: One Biden pick may have a harder time being confirmed. Here's why
description: CNN's Jeff Zeleny reports on President-elect Joe Biden's diverse economic team with four women in top roles.

title: US Navy to scrap billion-dollar warship after fire
description: The US Navy has decided to de-commission and scrap the USS Bonhomme Richard after a damage assessment found that restoring the ship would cost billions of dollars.

title: China document leak shows flawed pandemic response
description: An unprecedented leak of internal Chinese documents reveals how the country mishandled the early stages of the coronavirus pandemic. The documents - from Hubei province, the site of the world's first known outbreak - show China announced misleading numbers of new cases and deaths, was hampered by an average three-week delay in diagnosing new cases, and experienced a huge spike in influenza in the epicenter province in early December.

title: Keilar: Biden won the election and it wasn't even close
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar discusses how Fox News is enabling President Trump's 2020 election conspiracy theories despite them lacking evidence and plausibility.

title: Bon Appetit had a culture problem. She wants to change that
description: Dawn Davis was a powerhouse in the book industry when Anna Wintour emailed her about joining Condé Nast. Now, Davis is in charge of Bon Appétit, helping move the food magazine beyond just recipes.

title: Former CIA director 'concerned' over Trump's claims
description: Former CIA Director John Brennan compares President Donald Trump's disinformation campaign with similar tactics used by Russia to influence the American people.

title: George Clooney makes surprising grooming confession
description: Actor George Clooney revealed that he has been using a Flowbee to cut his own hair for more than two decades.

title: Physician: 'This is like a natural disaster occurring in all 50 states'
description: As millions of people in the United States travel back home from the Thanksgiving holiday, Covid-19 hospitalizations are inching closer to 100,000 -- the highest they've ever been. With infections expected to increase, experts say the stakes are even higher for the public to get tested to help slow the spread.

title: Trump sulks after his election defeat and leaves US in limbo
Jennifer Lawrence's family farm loses barn in fire
description: Part of Jennifer Lawrence's family farm in Kentucky, which also operates a summer camp, was destroyed by a fire over the weekend, according to a statement from the camp.

title: Disney honors Chadwick Boseman's birthday with tribute
description: Chadwick Boseman would have turned 44 on November 29 and Disney honored him in a way that was fit for a Marvel king.

title: Senegal World Cup star Papa Bouba Diop dies aged 42, reports say
description: Former Premier League player and Senegal World Cup star Papa Bouba Diop has died aged 42, according to multiple reports including ESPN.

title: Biden moves quickly to build a diverse administration
Tom Brady loses battle against reigning Super Bowl MVP Patrick Mahomes
description: The 'Comeback Kid' wasn't able to get it done this time.

title: If you're going to ski, here's how to do it safely in the pandemic
description: Avid snowboarder Jenny Leveille doesn't plan to rely on ski resorts' indoor facilities this season. This decision, she believes, will give her a possible advantage when it comes to coronavirus and swirling concerns over indoor exposure.

title: Moderna to apply today for FDA authorization for its vaccine
description: Pharmaceutical company Moderna intends to apply Monday to the US Food and Drug Administration for authorization of its Covid-19 vaccine.

title: British woman goes missing while hiking in Pyrenees mountain range
description: A British hiker has gone missing during a solo trip in the Pyrenees mountain range on the border between France and Spain.

title: Avlon: Trump should be treated the same way as someone who thinks the Earth is flat
description: CNN's John Avlon details President Trump's continued efforts to spread misinformation following the 2020 election.

title: Supreme Court hears arguments in Trump plan to cut undocumented immigrants from Census
description: The Supreme Court on Monday will return and take up another of President Donald Trump's immigration-related policies as it considers the attempt to exclude undocumented immigrants from being counted in the Census totals when seats in Congress are divvied up between the states next year.

title: Assassinated Iranian scientist shot with remote-controlled machine gun, report says
description: • Video: How the US and Iran became enemies

title: New Zealand media giant Stuff apologizes for racism toward indigenous Māori people
description: New Zealand's largest media publisher, Stuff, has publicly apologized for the way it has portrayed Māori people, after an internal investigation uncovered evidence of "racism and marginalisation" in its representation of the country's Indigenous people.

title: Romain Grosjean hails halo as the 'greatest thing' in F1 after horrific crash at Bahrain GP
description: Once skeptical of the halo safety device on Formula One cars, Romain Grosjean acknowledged it likely saved his life after a horrific crash at the Bahrain Grand Prix that saw his car split in half and engulfed in flames.

title: UK minister calls on Netflix to tell viewers 'The Crown' is fictional before each episode
description: The UK's Culture Secretary has called on Netflix to put a disclaimer at the start of episodes of "The Crown" telling viewers that the royal drama is "a work of fiction."

title: Coronavirus cases fell by roughly 30% during England's lockdown
description: Coronavirus cases dropped by around 30% in England during the country's second national lockdown, researchers say.

title: The President fired off delusional new claims to bolster his fantasy that the election was stolen, all while America continues to reckon with a worsening virus
description: America is sliding into a winter limbo of alarming spikes in Covid-19 cases and deepening economic pain while an apathetic lame duck White House and a deadlocked Congress provide no political leadership.

title: Biden has hairline fractures in his foot after slipping while playing with his dog
description: President-elect Joe Biden has hairline fractures in his "mid-foot" and will "likely require a walking boot for several weeks," his doctor said in a statement Sunday, after Biden slipped while playing with his dog, Major, Saturday.

title: Australia demands apology after Chinese official tweets 'falsified image' of soldier threatening child
description: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison has demanded the Chinese government delete a "repugnant" and "falsified image" on Twitter that appears to show an Australian soldier threatening to slit a child's throat.

title: China's tariffs slam door shut on Australian wine's biggest export market
description: Australia's winemakers are scrambling to find new buyers around the world after China imposed hefty tariffs on the industry, effectively cutting it off from its most important export market.

title: Black churches enlist mental health pros to support community
description: Wilma Mayfield used to visit a senior center in Durham, North Carolina, four days a week and attend Lincoln Memorial Baptist Church on Sundays, a ritual she has maintained for nearly half a century. But over the past 10 months, she's seen only the inside of her home, the grocery store and the pharmacy. Most of her days are spent worrying about Covid-19 and watching TV.

title: How to deal with grief — and persevere — mid-pandemic
description: When she began writing her new book, "Keep Moving," poet Maggie Smith had no idea how much the world would be suffering by the time it came out. Her "notes to self" have resonated deeply with many struggling to grieve our own mid-pandemic losses.

title: Argentine police search home of Diego Maradona's doctor following the soccer great's death
description: Argentine police have searched the house and office of Diego Maradona's doctor, as authorities investigate the death of the soccer great.

title: Thai protest leaders report to police on charges of insulting the monarchy, as authorities' tolerance wears out
description: Five pro-democracy leaders reported to Thai police Monday to face accusations of lese majeste -- a controversial and sweeping law that prohibits criticism of Thailand's royal family -- as authorities attempt to crack down on the country's growing protest movement.

title: New Zealand officials file charges over deadly White Island volcano eruption
description: New Zealand officials have filed charges against 13 parties that allegedly failed to meet their health and safety obligations when visiting an active volcano which killed 22 when it erupted last year.

title: Kim Jong Un is cutting off his economic lifeline, China, to stave off Covid-19
description: Kim Jong Un appears to have kicked North Korea's pandemic prevention plan into overdrive, further tightening the country's nearly impassible borders, cutting off nearly all trade with China and even allegedly executing a customs officials for failing to handle imported goods appropriately.

title: 'Firehose of falsehood:' How Trump is trying to confuse the public about the election outcome
description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

title: Assassinated Iranian nuclear scientist shot with remote-controlled machine gun: report
Blind photographer can 'see' thanks to his electronic eyes
description: On holiday in Iceland a few years ago, Pranav Lal listened to the Northern Lights. As they danced above his head he heard noises, swift and high-pitched, he recalls. Out of these sounds, shapes and patterns emerged, and from them, images.

title: CNN media correspondents break down Trump's Fox interview
description: CNN's Brian Stelter, Oliver Darcy and Amanda Carpenter break down President Trump's interview with Fox News anchor Maria Bartiromo, his first since the election.

title: 'Every day was terrible': 64-year-old Hong Kong protester on detainment
description: CNN's Ivan Watson talks with 64-year-old Alexandra Wong, affectionately nicknamed 'Grandma Wong', who was a striking figure of Hong Kong's pro-democracy movement before she was detained for 14 months in mainland China.

title: Psychologist sings on YouTube to help kids cope with stress
description: Adam Parker, a psychologist at Heritage Elementary School in Centennial, Colorado, has garnered a global following of students and kids for his catchy tunes about mental health.
